channel.title: cloud native on James Strong
channel.description: Recent content in cloud native on James Strong

item.title: Cloud Native Summit Online Stream Experience
item.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jv69-lSc1aA Streaming the @CloudNativeFdn online summit now! Join at https://t.co/tdiPEqWakA #cloudnative #cloudnativesummit pic.twitter.com/j1zrJQC5If — James Strong (@strongjz) April 7, 2020 The Tech used Panelist: Zoom meeting Breakouts Separate Zoom Meeting Stream: Open Broadcast Software Polls: Restream with OBS browswer Plugin Twitter feed: https://twitterfall.com/ with OBS broswer plugin Stream Source: OBS on my home setup Stream Destinations: Youtube Live and Periscope The speaker and panelist joined zoom as I did too.

item.title: Hashicorp DFW
item.description: I will be giving a talk and demo on deploying serverless apps onto AWS with Terraform! https://www.meetup.com/hashicorpdfw/events/260071773/

item.title: Kubernetes and Cloud Native Computing April Meetup
item.description: The inaugural Kubernetes and Cloud Native Computer Louisville will be on April 4th. I will be presenting an “Intro to Kubernetes” https://www.meetup.com/Kubernetes-and-Cloud-Native-Computing-Louisville/events/259202067/

item.title: Passing the CKA
item.description: On December 29th I completed my final goal of the year - I passed the CKA. TL;DR This is a list of the bare minimum necessary to try to pass. Do Kelsey Hightowerâ€™s tutorial Kubernetes The Hard Way at least three times! Understand it, internalize it. Do all the tasks on https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/ Read Kubernetes in Action by Marko Luksa Also practice, practice, and practice. Did I mention practice? This is a practical exam, no multiple choice questions here.
